table.name: PKG_CACHE_STMT

messages.SQL0551N: Security issue. Please install "Monitoring Switches/Security" in Tools -> Installed Components

table.description: This view is a point-in-time view of both static and dynamic SQL statements in the database package cache. The Rows Returned column shows the percentage of the rows read by a statement that are also returned to the application. It is a good indication of the overall efficiency of the statement. The Time Working column shows the percentage of time spent by the statement working compared to the time waiting for resources. It retrieves information using a monitor table function introduced in DB2 9.7. Each row displays metrics for a statement returned by the MON_GET_PKG_CACHE_STMT table function. This view is not available for databases prior to DB2 9.7.

column.name: return_effectiveness
column.sqlName: 100*FLOAT(ROWS_RETURNED)/(case when ROWS_READ=0 then 1 else ROWS_READ end)
column.title: Selected %

column.name: TOTAL_ROUTINE_NON_SECT_PROC_TIME
column.title: Total Routine Non Sect Proc Time

column.name: TOTAL_ROUTINE_USER_CODE_PROC_TIME
column.title: Total Routine User Code Proc Time
